titles.title: A bill to require prior notification of the Congress of anticipated commitments of United States funds to United Nations peacekeeping activities in excess of available appropriations.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6453-6455)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S8420-8422)

bill.summary: 5/25/1993--Introduced. Requires the United States Permanent Representative to the United Nations (UN) to notify the Congress in advance of any meeting of the UN Security Council held to decide whether to call upon member countries to participate in international peacekeeping activities, if participation by the United States in such activities would require an obligation of funds in excess of amounts made available to the UN for that fiscal year.
